titleStmt.title: J. Saige Dury et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9071

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency, Hon Jas. F. Robinson --

The undersigned would respectfully represent that at the present (April) term of the Boyd Circuit Court, a judgement was rendered in behalf of the Commonwealth against J. L, Tureman, for $50,,00, for selling liquor to a minor -- The liquor seems to have been sold during the war -- as Home Guard -- excitement in the neighborhood. Mr Tureman is not a habitual violator of the law, & this is his first case -- & as he had been an efficient loyal man in these war times -- we think your Excellency would be justified, on the whole, to remit his fine in this instance.

J. S. Dury
R W Eastham D S B C
James W Riely
W. V. Hampton
C, L, McConnell
H M Honaker
L Moore
Pettn of Citizens of Boyd Count to remit fine of Truman
